pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:0.4.eng: 1. The training rule on emission of semen

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:0.5.pli: Ime kho panāyasmanto terasa saṅghādisesā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:0.5.eng: Venerables, these thirteen rules on suspension come up for recitation.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā seyyasako anabhirato brahmacariyaṃ carati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.2.eng: At that time Venerable Seyyasaka was dissatisfied with the spiritual life.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.3.pli: So tena kiso hoti lūkho dubbaṇṇo uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajāto dhamanisanthatagatto.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.3.eng: He became thin, haggard, and pale, with veins protruding all over his body.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.4.pli: Addasa kho āyasmā udāyī āyasmantaṃ seyyasakaṃ kisaṃ lūkhaṃ dubbaṇṇaṃ uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajātaṃ dhamanisanthatagattaṃ. Disvāna āyasmantaṃ seyyasakaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.4.eng: Venerable Udāyī saw him in this condition and said to him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.5.pli: “kissa tvaṃ, āvuso seyyasaka, kiso lūkho dubbaṇṇo uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajāto dhamanisanthatagatto?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.6.pli: Kacci no tvaṃ, āvuso seyyasaka, anabhirato brahmacariyaṃ carasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.6.eng: You’re not dissatisfied with the spiritual life, are you?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.8.pli: “Tena hi tvaṃ, āvuso seyyasaka, yāvadatthaṃ bhuñja yāvadatthaṃ supa yāvadatthaṃ nhāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.8.eng: “Well then, eat , sleep, and bathe as much as you like.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.9.pli: Yāvadatthaṃ bhuñjitvā yāvadatthaṃ supitvā yāvadatthaṃ nhāyitvā yadā te anabhirati uppajjati rāgo cittaṃ anuddhaṃseti tadā hatthena upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocehī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.9.eng: And whenever you become discontent and lust overwhelms you, just masturbate with your hand.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.10.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, āvuso, kappati evarūpaṃ kātun”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.12.pli: Atha kho āyasmā seyyasako yāvadatthaṃ bhuñji yāvadatthaṃ supi yāvadatthaṃ nhāyi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.12.eng: Then Seyyasaka ate, slept, and bathed as much as he liked,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.13.pli: Yāvadatthaṃ bhuñjitvā yāvadatthaṃ supitvā yāvadatthaṃ nhāyitvā yadā anabhirati uppajjati rāgo cittaṃ anuddhaṃseti tadā hatthena upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.13.eng: and whenever he became discontent and lust overwhelmed him, he masturbated with his hand.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.14.pli: Atha kho āyasmā seyyasako aparena samayena vaṇṇavā ahosi pīṇindriyo pasannamukhavaṇṇo vippasannachavivaṇṇo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.14.eng: After some time Seyyasaka had a good color, a bright face, clear skin, and sharp senses.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.15.pli: Atha kho āyasmato seyyasakassa sahāyakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ seyyasakaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.15.eng: The monks who were his friends said to him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.16.pli: “pubbe kho tvaṃ, āvuso seyyasaka, kiso ahosi lūkho dubbaṇṇo uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajāto dhamanisanthatagatto.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.16.eng: “Seyyasaka, you used to be thin, haggard, and pale, with veins protruding all over your body.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.17.pli: So dāni tvaṃ etarahi vaṇṇavā pīṇindriyo pasannamukhavaṇṇo vippasannachavivaṇṇo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.17.eng: But now you have a good color, a bright face, clear skin, and sharp senses.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.18.pli: Kiṃ nu kho tvaṃ, āvuso seyyasaka, bhesajjaṃ karosī”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.20.pli: Api cāhaṃ yāvadatthaṃ bhuñjāmi yāvadatthaṃ supāmi yāvadatthaṃ nhāyāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.20.eng: I just eat, sleep, and bathe as much as I like,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.21.pli: Yāvadatthaṃ bhuñjitvā yāvadatthaṃ supitvā yāvadatthaṃ nhāyitvā yadā me anabhirati uppajjati rāgo cittaṃ anuddhaṃseti tadā hatthena upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocemī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.1.21.eng: and whenever I become discontent and lust overwhelms me, I masturbate with my hand.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.1.pli: “Kiṃ pana tvaṃ, āvuso seyyasaka, yeneva hatthena saddhādeyyaṃ bhuñjasi teneva hatthena upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocesī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.1.eng: “Do you eat the food given in faith with the same hand you use to masturbate?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.3.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.3.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā seyyasako hatthena upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocessatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.4.eng: “How can Venerable Seyyasaka masturbate with his hand?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.5.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ seyyasakaṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.5.eng: They rebuked Seyyasaka in many ways and then told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā āyasmantaṃ seyyasakaṃ paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.6.eng: The Buddha then had the Sangha gathered and questioned Seyyasaka:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, seyyasaka, hatthena upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocesī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.7.eng: “Is it true, Seyyasaka, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.10.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.10.eng: “Foolish man, it’s not suitable, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.11.pli: Kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, hatthena upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocessasi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.12.pli: Nanu mayā, moghapurisa, anekapariyāyena virāgāya dhammo desito no sarāgāya,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.12.eng: Haven’t I given many teachings for the sake of dispassion, not for the sake of passion;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.13.eng: for freedom from bondage, not for the sake of bondage;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.14.eng: for the sake of non-grasping, not for the sake of grasping?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.15.pli: Tattha nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, mayā virāgāya dhamme desite sarāgāya cetessasi, visaññogāya dhamme desite saññogāya cetessasi, anupādānāya dhamme desite saupādānāya cetessasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.15.eng: When I’ve taught like this, how can you choose passion, bondage, and grasping?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.16.pli: Nanu mayā, moghapurisa, anekapariyāyena rāgavirāgāya dhammo desito, madanimmadanāya pipāsavinayāya ālayasamugghātāya vaṭṭupacchedāya taṇhākkhayāya virāgāya nirodhāya nibbānāya dhammo desito?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.16.eng: Haven’t I given many teachings for the fading away of lust, for the clearing away of intoxication, for the removal of thirst, for the uprooting of attachment, for the cutting off of the round of rebirth, for the stopping of craving, for fading away, for ending, for extinguishment?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.17.pli: Nanu mayā, moghapurisa, anekapariyāyena kāmānaṃ pahānaṃ akkhātaṃ, kāmasaññānaṃ pariññā akkhātā, kāmapipāsānaṃ paṭivinayo akkhāto, kāmavitakkānaṃ samugghāto akkhāto, kāmapariḷāhānaṃ vūpasamo akkhāto?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.17.eng: Haven’t I given many teachings for the abandoning of worldly pleasures, for the full understanding of the perceptions of worldly pleasures, for the removal of thirst for worldly pleasures, for the elimination of thoughts of worldly pleasures, for the stilling of the fevers of worldly pleasures?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.18.pli: Netaṃ, moghapurisa, appasannānaṃ vā pasādāya, pasannānaṃ vā bhiyyobhāvāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.18.eng: Foolish man, this will affect people’s confidence,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.19.pli: Atha khvetaṃ, moghapurisa, appasannānañceva appasādāya, pasannānañca ekaccānaṃ aññathattāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.19.eng: and cause some to lose it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.20.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ seyyasakaṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.20.eng: Then, after rebuking Seyyasaka in many ways, the Buddha spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.21.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.21.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.22.1.eng: ‘Intentional emission of semen is an offense entailing suspension.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.23.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:1.2.23.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū paṇītabhojanāni bhuñjitvā muṭṭhassatī asampajānā niddaṃ okkamanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards some monks ate fine foods, fell asleep absentminded and heedless,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.1.2.pli: Tesaṃ muṭṭhassatīnaṃ asampajānānaṃ niddaṃ okkamantānaṃ supinantena asuci muccati.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.1.4.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a training rule

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.1.5.eng: that intentional emission of semen is an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.1.6.eng: We had an emission while dreaming,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.1.8.pli: Kacci nu kho mayaṃ saṅghādisesaṃ āpattiṃ āpannā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.1.8.eng: Could it be that we’ve committed an offense entailing suspension?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.1.10.eng: “It’s true, monks, that a dream is not without intention,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.1.12.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.1.12.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.1.13.1.eng: ‘Intentional emission of semen, except while dreaming, is an offense entailing suspension.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.2.2.eng: knowing, perceiving, having intended, having decided, he transgresses.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.2.4.eng: there are ten kinds of semen:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.2.5.pli: nīlaṃ pītakaṃ lohitakaṃ odātaṃ takkavaṇṇaṃ dakavaṇṇaṃ telavaṇṇaṃ khīravaṇṇaṃ dadhivaṇṇaṃ sappivaṇṇaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.2.5.eng: blue, yellow, red, white, the color of buttermilk, the color of water, the color of oil, the color of milk, the color of curd, the color of ghee.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.2.7.eng: making it move from its base—this is what is meant by “emission”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.2.9.eng: apart from that which occurs while dreaming.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.2.11.pli: saṅghova tassā āpattiyā parivāsaṃ deti, mūlāya paṭikassati, mānattaṃ deti, abbheti; na sambahulā, na ekapuggalo. Tena vuccati—“saṅghādiseso”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.2.11.eng: only the Sangha gives probation for that offense, sends back to the beginning, gives the trial period, and rehabilitates—not several monks, not an individual. Therefore it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.2.11.comm: “Gives the trial period” renders mānattaṁ deti. For the meaning of mānatta see Bhikkhu Ñāṇatusita, “Analysis of the Bhikkhu Pātimokkha”, p. 123. | The point here, which can only be understood from the Pali, is that the word saṅghādisesa (saṅgha + ādisesa) is derived from the fact that only the saṅgha can do the legal procedures required when a monastic commits this offense. | “Several” renders sambahula. See Appendix of Technical Terms for a discussion of this rendering.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.2.12.pli: Tasseva āpattinikāyassa nāmakammaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Tenapi vuccati—“saṅghādiseso”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:2.2.12.eng: This is the name and designation of this class of offense. Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.2.36.pli: nīlaṃ bhavissati, pītakaṃ bhavissati, lohitakaṃ bhavissati, odātaṃ bhavissati, takkavaṇṇaṃ bhavissati, dakavaṇṇaṃ bhavissati, telavaṇṇaṃ bhavissati, khīravaṇṇaṃ bhavissati, dadhivaṇṇaṃ bhavissati, sappivaṇṇaṃ bhavissatīti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.2.36.eng: thinking, “Will it be blue?”, “Will it be yellow?”, “Will it be red?”, “Will it be white?”, “Will it be the color of buttermilk?”, “Will it be the color of water?”, “Will it be the color of oil?”, “Will it be the color of milk?”, “Will it be the color of curd?”, “Will it be the color of ghee?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.3.1.pli: Ajjhattarūpe ceteti upakkamati muccati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.3.1.eng: If, by means of his own body, he intends and makes an effort, and semen is emitted, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.3.2.pli: Bahiddhārūpe ceteti upakkamati muccati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.3.2.eng: If, by means of something external, he intends and makes an effort, and semen is emitted, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.3.3.pli: Ajjhattabahiddhārūpe ceteti upakkamati muccati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.3.3.eng: If, both by means of his own body and by means of something external, he intends and makes an effort, and semen is emitted, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.3.4.pli: Ākāse kaṭiṃ kampento ceteti upakkamati muccati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.3.4.eng: If, shaking the pelvis in the air, he intends and makes an effort, and semen is emitted, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.3.5.pli: Rāgūpatthambhe ceteti upakkamati muccati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.3.5.eng: If, when there is stiffness due to sensual desire, he intends and makes an effort, and semen is emitted, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.3.6.pli: Vaccūpatthambhe ceteti upakkamati muccati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.3.6.eng: If, when there is stiffness due to feces, he intends and makes an effort, and semen is emitted, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.3.7.pli: Passāvūpatthambhe ceteti upakkamati muccati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.3.7.eng: If, when there is stiffness due to urine, he intends and makes an effort, and semen is emitted, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.3.8.pli: Vātūpatthambhe ceteti upakkamati muccati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.6.104.1.pli: Timūlakampi catumūlakampi pañcamūlakampi chamūlakampi sattamūlakampi aṭṭhamūlakampi navamūlakampi evameva vitthāretabbaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.6.105.1.eng: This is the section based on all items:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.6.106.pli: Nīlañca pītakañca lohitakañca odātañca takkavaṇṇañca dakavaṇṇañca telavaṇṇañca khīravaṇṇañca dadhivaṇṇañca sappivaṇṇañca ceteti upakkamati muccati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.6.107.eng: The section based on all items is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.7.2.pli: Ārogyatthañca sukhatthañca nīlañca pītakañca ceteti upakkamati muccati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.7.2.eng: If he intends for the sake of health and for the sake of pleasure and blue and yellow, makes an effort, and semen is emitted, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.7.4.eng: (In this way both aspects are to be expanded.)

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:3.7.5.eng: If he intends for the sake of health and for the sake of pleasure and for the sake of medicine and for the sake of a gift and for the sake of merit and for the sake of sacrifice and for the sake of heaven and for the sake of seed and for the sake of investigating and for the sake of fun and blue and yellow and red and white and the color of buttermilk and the color of water and the color of oil and the color of milk and the color of curd and the color of ghee, makes an effort, and semen is emitted, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:5.9.7.comm: Bhikkhu Ṭhānissaro argues in “The Buddhist Monastic Code I”, page 105, that it was the novice monk who emitted semen. But these rules concern monks, not novices. In the present case the Buddha specifically says that there is no offense of saṅghādisesa, which would make no sense if it referred to the novice monk. Bhikkhu Ṭhānissaro argues that his reading is required, otherwise we are forced to conclude that saṅghādisesa offenses can be incurred by indirect stimulation. Yet the cases found here are widely diverging. It is not a given that they must all, even potentially, give rise to a saṅghādisesa.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:5.16.17.comm: Sp-ṭ 1.267: Pupphāvalīti kīḷāvisesassādhivacanaṁ. Playing it in rivers, etc., having made a muddy, steep slope with water, having extended both feet right there, they sit and slide down.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:5.16.19.eng: “There’s no offense if one isn’t aiming at emission.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:5.16.20.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno mocanādhippāyassa pupphāvaliyaṃ kīḷantassa asuci mucci …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss1:5.16.20.eng: On one occasion a monk, aiming at emission, was playing by sliding in the mud, and semen was emitted. …
